result.summary_1_page: The Samsung Galaxy S25 delivers flagship performance with the Snapdragon 8 Elite chip, praised by all 8 sources for its speed (Geekbench 10050, AnTuTu 2.19M). It maintains a compact 162g titanium-frame design with Gorilla Glass Victus 2 and IP68 rating. The 6.2-inch Dynamic AMOLED display hits 2600 nits peak (1395 nits measured) but uses 240Hz PWM dimming. Camera hardware remains unchanged since S22, with DXOMark awarding the display 157 points. Battery life sees modest gains (13-15h active use), while 25W charging is universally criticized. One UI 7 and 7-year software support are highlights, though AI features feel underdeveloped.
pros: Snapdragon 8 Elite delivers class-leading performance (NotebookCheck, GSMArena, TechRadar)
7 years of software updates (all sources highlight)
Improved battery efficiency despite 4000mAh capacity (TomsGuide, NotebookCheck)
cons: 25W charging is slow vs competitors (criticized by all 8 sources)
Reused 50MP main camera from S22 (PhoneArena, AndroidCentral, NotebookCheck)
No UWB support on base model (AndroidCentral, TechRadar)
PWM dimming at 240Hz causes eye strain concerns (NotebookCheck)
Qi2 wireless requires magnetic case (AndroidCentral, GSMArena)

attributes.name: Camera
attributes.explanation: 50MP main sensor unchanged since S22. DXOMark notes good daylight performance but low-light weaknesses. Telephoto praised, ultrawide lacks AF (GSMArena, PhoneArena, NotebookCheck).

attributes.name: Battery Endurance
attributes.explanation: 4000mAh battery achieves 13-15h active use. 25W charging takes 77min for full charge – slowest in class (GSMArena test: 13:09h, TomsGuide: 15:43h).

attributes.name: Performance
attributes.explanation: Snapdragon 8 Elite dominates benchmarks: Geekbench 10050 multi-core, AnTuTu 2.19M. Sustained performance dips 47% under load (NotebookCheck thermal tests).

attributes.name: Display
attributes.explanation: Dynamic AMOLED 2X with 2600 nits peak (1395 nits measured), 120Hz LTPO. DXOMark awards 157 display score. PWM dimming at 240Hz noted (NotebookCheck, GSMArena).

attributes.name: Software Experience
attributes.explanation: One UI 7 praised for redesign and AI integration. 7-year update promise. Galaxy AI features like Live Translate and ProVisual Engine (AndroidCentral, TomsGuide).

attributes.name: Design & Build
attributes.explanation: Titanium frame reduces weight to 162g (-6g vs S24). Gorilla Glass Victus 2, IP68 rating. Compact 146.9mm height praised (GSMArena, AndroidCentral).

attributes.name: Longevity Value
attributes.explanation: 7-year support leads Android. High resale value historically. $799 base price matches S24 but lacks hardware innovation (PhoneArena, NotebookCheck).
